name: 8 kg (Approx 18 lb) Kettlebell
description:
The 8 kg kettlebell is a traditional size for women starting kettlebell training, especially for those who are not coming to kettlebells with a solid base of strength training.  This size is especially useful for getups and presses.

++++++++

Order more than one kettlebell (any size combination) and save 10% on your entire order.  Just use the term MULTI at checkout.  (Sorry, discount can't be combined with other discounts.)

name: 10 kg (Approx 22 lb) Kettlebell
description:
The 10 kg kettlebell is slightly heavier than the 8 kg kettlebell, and like the 8 kg, it's a good place to start for those new to kettlebell training.  It is also a nice bridge weight for those close to moving up to the 12 kg for presses and getups.

For swings, we recommend jumping from the 8 kg to the 12 kg.

++++++++

Order more than one kettlebell (any size combination) and save 10% on your entire order.  Just use the term MULTI at checkout.  (Sorry, discount can't be combined with other discounts.)

name: 12 kg (Approx 26 lb) Kettlebell
description:
The 12 kg kettlebell is the bread and butter starter kettlebell for most women who come to kettlebell training with some base in strength training.  It is a solid utility player that will continue to be effective, even as you develop your skills.  At first, it's terrific for 2-hand swings.  Later, it will be a standard bell for 1-hand swings, cleans and snatches, as well as snatches and military presses.

The 12 kg is not just for women!  Even for the strongest users, the 12 kg is useful for warmups, arm bars, pistols and loaded pull-ups.  

This kettlebell belongs in the gym of practically everyone who trains with kettlebells.

++++++++

Order more than one kettlebell (any size combination) and save 10% on your entire order.  Just use the term MULTI at checkout.  (Sorry, discount can't be combined with other discounts.)

name: 14 kg (Approx 31 lb) Kettlebell
description:
The 14 kg kettlebell is one of the best kept secrets of the kettlebell world.  For most women, the leap between the 12 kg and the 16 kg for presses and snatches can feel like a canyon.  The 14 kg helps bridge that gap and can lead to quicker advances overall.  This size is the secret weapon for those who are ready to move to the next level in overhead work.

++++++++

name: 22 kg (Approx 48 lb) Kettlebell
description:
This is a new size of Dragon Door kettlebell.  It is the perfect size for those who are stuck between the 20 kg and the 24 kg for presses, loaded pull-ups and pistols.

(In most cases, for swings and snatches, however, we recommend jumping straight to the 24 kg from the 20 kg.)

++++++++

name: 48 kg (Approx 106 lb) Kettlebell
description:
The Beast.  The 48 kg kettlebell is for only the strongest, fiercest kettlebell users.  It is the RKC2 military press test size for many men, and it is the size that men must use to become a Beast Tamer (press, pistol and loaded pull-up).  The Beast is not for the faint of heart.

++++++++
